Editor basics:
* Give your sheet a meaningful title so you can find it easily - and for the benefit of your audience. 
* Freely type or paste your thoughts, insights and questions. 
* Changes are saved as they are made, and any errors which prevent saving are indicated.

Use the [+] and ["] buttons to insert a source by typing book name + reference (e.g., "Genesis 1:1").
* Alternatively, while viewing a book in the library, select text and click "Add to Sheet" in Resources. This second method offers more control. [Learn More](https://example.com).
* Note: Sources are displayed according to the Language [A] setting of the user viewing your sheet.

Select the target text and choose the desired formatting from the toolbar. 
* Library source texts support bold, italic, underline, and highlighting. 
* Typed or pasted text also supports bullets and numbered lists, links, and headings. 
* For advanced formatting, [export to Google Docs](https://example.com) or use the [Sefaria Google Docs Extension](https://example.com).

Delete an added source:
* Select a source and press the [Delete] key. 

Move an added source:
* Drag and drop to move sources a short distance. 
* Move sources a longer distance by using Cut + Paste.

Optionally enrich your sheet with engaging audiovisual content: 
* Use the "Plus" and "Picture" buttons to upload an image from your computer.
* Use the "Plus" and "Media" buttons to embed video or audio with a web link

[Learn More](https://example.com)

When you are ready to publish and make your sheet available to Sefaria users:
* Write a clear summary which captures the essence of your sheet
* Add Topics to further descrbie it and make it easier to find

For more robust formatting options and full control over printed sheets, use the Export to Google Docs feature found in the Resources panel. Your first export will require you to associate your Google Account with your Sefaria Account - just follow the prompts.

For complete instructions, see [this article](https://example.com). 
* To reopen this Quick Start Guide, click the lightbulb icon at the top of your sheet. 
* Your sheets can be found in your Profile. 
* **We would love** to hear about the types of sheets you make, please be in touch using the feedback link below or by writing to hello@sefaria.org!
